## Individual slides

-   They are marked with \# or \## and the title

## Incremental Points

use div, i.e, ":::{incremental} content list :::"

::: incremental
-   This comes first

-   This second
:::

## Columns

use div, ":::{.columns} This is outside :::{.column .fragment} content 1 :::

::: content 2 {.column .fragment} :::

This is outside The `.fragment` span style helps to achieve sequencial appearance, just like `.incremental` in list. `.incremental` works only with list :::"

::: columns

------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is outside the column, may be heading

::: {.column .fragment width="20%"}
content 1
:::

::: {.column .fragment width="80%"}
content 2
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is outside the column, again a leagent or something like that
:::

## Footnote and Speaker notes

div ":::aside ::: for footnote"

"::: notes ::: for speaker notes. Hit `s` to reveal speaker notes"

::: aside
This is a footnote
:::

::: notes
This is a speaker note
:::
